entry.title: Turkey Declares State of Emergency in Quake-Hit Regions
entry.content: Snowfall and blocked roads hindered efforts to respond to two powerful earthquakes that killed more than 5,150 people in southern Turkey and northern Syria, leading Turkey’s president to declare a three-month state of emergency in affected areas.

entry.title: Russia Pushes on Several Fronts in Ukraine
entry.content: Russian forces launched multiple attacks in eastern Ukraine, pushing for a breakthrough on the battlefield ahead of the delivery of new Western weapons.

entry.title: Thailand Pins Hopes on Return of Chinese Tourists
entry.content: Vacationers from China, absent for years because of Beijing’s strict zero-Covid policy, are vital to the revival of the country’s travel industry.

entry.title: The U.K.'s Government-Run Healthcare Service Is in Crisis
entry.content: Ill children turned away from hospitals. Three-day-long emergency room waits. Nurses on strike. The NHS is struggling under the effects of budget cuts, Covid delays and an aging population.
